alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Carson; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:26PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Armstrong, northeastern Randall, southwestern Carson and southeastern Potter Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 426 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles west of Washburn, or 10 miles east of Amarillo, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Washburn and Pantex. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
